content:
You have several appointments today, as follows:
Doctor  - 10:00 AM
Physical Therapy - 12:30 PM
DMV--2:00 PM
Dinner Date - 6:00 PM

Answer the following questions based on the timeline given above.
You need to stop at the store and the dry cleaners before your dinner date, and you think you'll need at least 2 hours for these errands.  When would be a good time to get these two errands done?

chosen: Based on the timeline provided, the earliest you could run your errands would be between 4:00 p.m. and 6:00 p.m., since your dinner date is at 6:00 p.m. Any earlier than that, you have an appointment or engagement. If both tasks will take at least 2 hours, then 4:00 p.m. would be the latest you could start, in order to finish by 6:00 p.m.
rejected: The best time for your errands would be between 4:00 pm and 6:00 pm. Your DMV appointment is at 2:00 pm, so your errands won't interfere with that commitment. If your dinner date is at 6:00 pm, then you will have plenty of time to complete your errands and still make your date on time if you start by 4:00 pm. In fact, you may even finish early! Just in case something unexpected comes up, though, it's always a good idea to give yourself a little extra cushion time when making plans.
snapchosen: Based on the timeline provided, the earliest you could run your errands would be between 4:00 p.m. and 6:00 p.m., since your dinner date is at 6:00 p.m. Any earlier than that, you have an appointment or engagement. If both tasks will take at least 2 hours, then 4:00 p.m. would be the latest you could start, in order to finish by 6:00 p.m.
snaprejected: The best time for your errands would be between 4:00 pm and 6:00 pm. Your DMV appointment is at 2:00 pm, so your errands won't interfere with that commitment. If your dinner date is at 6:00 pm, then you will have plenty of time to complete your errands and still make your date on time if you start by 4:00 pm. In fact, you may even finish early! Just in case something unexpected comes up, though, it's always a good idea to give yourself a little extra cushion time when making plans.
